name: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. David H. SHREVE, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Office of Disciplinary Counsel v. Shreve
docket_number: No. 890, Disciplinary Docket No. 2; Disciplinary Board Nos. 89 DB 91 and 1 DB 92

parties: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. David H. SHREVE, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 3rd day of February, 1994, a Rule having been issued upon respondent on November 16, 1993, to show cause why he should not be placed on temporary suspension pursuant to Rule 208(f), Pa. R.D.E., and no response thereto having been filed, it is hereby
ORDERED that the Rule is made absolute; respondent is placed on temporary suspension pursuant to Rule 208(f), Pa.R.D.E.; and he shall comply with the provisions of Rule 217, Pa.R.D.E.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

casebody.head_matter:
OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. David H. SHREVE, Respondent.
No. 890, Disciplinary Docket No. 2.
Disciplinary Board Nos. 89 DB 91 and 1 DB 92.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Feb. 3, 1994.
